nl.quintor.solitaire.ui

Interface UI


  • public interface UI
    The basic UI interface, which can be used to implement a suitable UI using any technology.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void refresh(GameState gameState)
      Signals to the UI implementation that the game state has changed.
      java.lang.String refreshAndRequestMove(GameState gameState, java.util.Collection<Move> moves)
      Signals to the UI implementation that the game state has changed, and that player input is expected.
      void setErrorMessage(java.lang.String message)
      Set an error message to show the player the next time refresh(GameState) is called.
      void setMessage(java.lang.String message)
      Set a message to show the player the next time refresh(GameState) is called.

    • Method Detail

      • setMessage

        void setMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Set a message to show the player the next time refresh(GameState) is called. This message should be shown as a non-error message.
        Parameters:
        message - message to show the player

      • setErrorMessage

        void setErrorMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Set an error message to show the player the next time refresh(GameState) is called. This message should be shown as an error.
        Parameters:
        message - error message to show the player

      • refresh

        void refresh(GameState gameState)
        Signals to the UI implementation that the game state has changed. The UI may or may not refresh more often.
        Parameters:
        gameState - the game state to be visualized by the UI

      • refreshAndRequestMove

        java.lang.String refreshAndRequestMove(GameState gameState,
                                       java.util.Collection<Move> moves)
        Signals to the UI implementation that the game state has changed, and that player input is expected. The UI may or may not refresh more often.
        Parameters:
        gameState - the game state to be visualized by the UI
        moves - the moves that are possible in this game state
        Returns:
        String representation of the player request
